transcript.content: Jane's Addiction, Just Because on XFM 104.9. I'm Ricky Gervais, with me Steve Merchant and Karl Pilkington. We're all here then.
I imagine you've got all kinds of treats lined up, Rick.
Well, there's lots of things on the show. Great music. You know, Nirvana, Radiohead, The Darkness to name but three.
Can I play you something from Led Zeppelin later?
Yeah, please do. And maybe some Neil Young.
Um, now, coming up also on the show, we're continuing a thing we've started. We only got four weeks to go before maybe we either give it altogether or go away for a couple of months.
Is it four weeks or three weeks now?
Is it three weeks? Oh, I dunno.
I think it's the 16th of August, innit?

Well, it might be that - it'd be a shame to end it forever, but it's all up to Karl to - again, he's in a grumpy mood. We're trying to up his attitude and it's - it's them, it's the listener that counts, Karl, not us. We may be feeling bad but you, the listener, count. You come first, yeah? Okay, up, up, up. Yeah? Big. Big 'em up. Big up London. Big up you, the listener. Karl, leave yourself at home for a little while, yeah? Um, we're gonna continue that thing we started last week, we were doing the list of the most hated people in Britain. It's not us, it's the listeners. So, um, keep coming with those suggestions of people you just, uh - obviously you don't hate them. We don't want a list of mass murderers, dictators and politicians. You can have them, but uh --
Oh, um, mass murderers and politicians? What's the difference? Oh!
Satire, yeah. No, probably that - that's - we - we do some jokes like that as well, won't we?
We're trying to get onto Radio 4.
Trying to get on there, yeah.
If there's any kind of amusing show that perhaps takes a sideways look at the week's news.

Yeah. If there are any Radio 4 producers who are - you know, have been knocking around for about 12 years with the same old hacks and they're desperately trying to get on telly, they wanna give us a call, we're not interested!
We've got bigger fish to fry.
Um, but yeah, so if - people that you hate. Um, minor celebrities.
People on TV, pop stars you don't like. Email in, ricky.gervais@xfm.co.uk. We're compiling a list.
And I'll tell you what, then we do like the - Channel 4 do, then we give you the sort of list of the top 10 at the end and you can vote within that top 10. I tell you ones that are in front though --
Could we - sorry, could we wire up some kind of premium rate phone line so that we make a fortune?
We can't afford it. But if when you email in, if you could also maybe um send us a lottery ticket.

Then, you know, we'll make something out of this. The ones in the lead, and I'm no - doing no particular order, but these are the ones way out in front at the moment. It's Chris Moyles, Robbie Williams, Chris Tarrant, Davina McCall.
I'm sort of surprised at that. But I know that it's probably just overpopularity.
I think she's just been on TV too much lately.
Yeah, that t-shirt annoys me, "Big Mother".
That - that annoys me. Um, we don't care. We don't care whether you're pregnant or not. Loads of people have children. I don't care.
And uh, Dominic Monaghan. So, uh, there's - the - they're - I mean, but, think of your own.
There's a lot of people just coming up behind there, though. Graham Norton.
Graham Norton. Oh, there's the sort of stuff - it's sort of like we've done satire, we've done innuendo.
I mean, he's - he's the king of the double entendre.
Well, he's the king of the single entendre but we can double it up if you want.
104.9, this is the sort of things we're available - go on!
I'm loving this, this is gonna be good! I'm loving what's coming next, what?
If any of the producers of Carry On London are listening and they need some new talent to write some smutty innuendo, I think we're your men.
Karl, you better press the knob, right?
Ricky I know you're a Neil Young fan.

You probably won't have this album. It is basically not been available for years. It's never been available on CD before, it was part of this kind of trilogy of albums he did they were very depressing, and they've just been re-released. This is absolute dynamite. It's "On the beach", "On the beach"? Yeah. And that's the only track, "Walk on  - Neil Young"
Brilliant, on Xfm 104.9. That's the sort of stuff. You've had satire, had a little bit of politics. You've had, said, well we said "Spunk"
Which is a bit naughty, isn't it?
Which is a bit cutting edge.
Yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah, and you've had Neil Young and Jane's Addiction, so..
I can't think of anything else I'd rather...
Probably quite.. down with the kids and everything, aren't we?
Yeah, so, ohh, d'you know what else? Wish Tony Blair would just stop..
Good, that's good. Who else is there to have a go at? Peter Mandelson, or someone?
No, he's good, in' he? He's good 'cause he's gay, in' he?
I don't know. I don't know.
I don't know if he is. If he's not then I'm sorry, but
If he is then well done.
Brilliant. Good to, all gay people good.
Any underprivileged people, you're all brilliant, but people who are overprivileged, ooh.
All the mad shit they get up to.
..see on the news. It's just interesting, innit?
Yeah, yeah, crazy, some of it. Come on, [inaudible], what are you doing that for?
What are you doing that for?
So if you're listening and you work for Radio 4....
And doing good stuff! Good stuff and..
Yeah. Well, yeah. Eurodisney. That's good.
So anyway, that's the sort of satire 'n the, where we can kind of tear apart popular culture and just get to the very nub of it.
Yeah. Can I just leave you with this? D'you know my favorite country?
It is brilliant. It is huge. It is huge.
Not strictly a country, but, all the countries. Except the bad ones, remember the bad ones?
Play a record. If anyone from Radio 4 is listening.
Yeah, we would like to get on some kind of satire show, please.
Ricky Gervais. Steve Merchant. Karl Pilkington.
Yeah, going well, at the moment.
Not bad, not bad. You were just talking about foreigns.
I tell you something, I've been meaning to ask you this for a while, cause I know you're very well-informed man.
Yeah, political and sort of liberal and that
It's like, it's not like any other language.
Either spoken or written down.. well it's not written down, it's, it's.
Well when it's written down it basically looks like, kind of, little children's drawings of those little paper houses that Chinese people live in.
Well let's, it is, is, is, is, is a little.
And it's loads of them, it's hundreds of them from what I can make out.
But I mean even French have a go. It's not, even the French haven't got right words, but they've got some of the..
They make, they're trying to sound like English

..right letters and they've gone (in a terrible French accent) "Oh, hello, 'ow are you?" and it's sorta, they're trying to do the words, but there's just something wrong, I think it's just, it's like a speech impediment I think.
Yeah, Germans [inaudible], going (absolutely terrible German accent) "Ohhh, how are you?" And they're trying to do the words.
It's just, for want of a better word, it sounds to me, when I listen to Chinese it sounds like gobbledygook.
That's one, that's, that's, I think that's the main dialect. That, Mandarin and Orangutan. But I mean.. that..
But seriously, I mean, I can't figure it out, I just, I, there's no, I've got no grasp of how, 'cause it doesn't seem to relate to anything, like that's,
Well, it's not real words because there are sentences, like, you know we have a wo.. if we said, um, uhhh
A gentle man sits by the stream of fish.
Yeah, we use all the different words to each one of those words and we got a word for each of them.
They haven't they've just got I think it's like a triangle with a line through it.
Which can get confusing cos, you know...
So 'the quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog'.
That's just... I think that's like a little paper house with a feather on top.
Personally this is what I love to do. I want to use the fact that we're on the radio to answer these questions properly.
Yeah! To tell me about other cultures.
I would love to speak to a Chinese person.
But I just like to speak to someone ideally perhaps, you know a professor of Chinese...
Or someone who works in a chip shop but someone was actually born in Chinaland.
Someone born in Chinaland - a Chinaman or a Chinamanwoman... Just to talk us through exactly what it is they're going on about.
Exactly and it's not... It's just because I'm very ill informed. I've only really seen Chinese people in kung fu movies... You know?
More of a novelty str- A slippery novelty street.
Because I remember watching Kung Fu a lot. They always used to speak... They always say we speak very slowly don't they?
They never really... They are unscrutable.
You cannot scrute a Chinaman, or a Chinamanwoman.
They are unscrutable, they are non-scrutable. If I was to go out on the street now and try and scrute a Chinaman...
You could not scrute a Chinaman for love nor money.
I could possibly scrute a Chinese woman.
Well, I don't think you'd have any luck. You've had no luck.

Anyway if you are a Chinaman, or a Chinamanwoman, who can just tell us basically how it works. How would you teach us the basics of Chinese if you if we were going to go to China and we wanted to interact? Why would we start? What would be the first word we would say, how would we say them? How would we write them? Please help.
This is going to run and run.
See? Proper normal... Normal talking there from Karl Pilkington.
Whole Lotta Love from Led Zeppelin. Classic.
On Xfm 104.9. I'm Ricky Gervais, with me Steve Merchant, Karl Pilkington.
We've not heard much from Karl this week.
We've not heard much from anyone that can speak Chinese for us either... So er, we'll knock that one on the head. I don't think we'll be learning Chinese today, Steve.
What annoys me is I'm going to go out into the world still ignorant.
I know. Yeah. The only Chinese I learnt was from Benny Hill.
Now Benny Hill could speak fluent Chinese.
Well, the only ones I know is er... "you silly idiot" is "you sirry iriot".
Yeah, that's all... [unintelligible] it'll get you by in Peking but I mean... you come in, you hit a dialect... you know, your worms meat.
Karl. Yeah, we haven't heard a lot from you. But we've been going here. We've done a few features already. We've talked about different parts of the world...
Man of few words. I mean literally...
I've had a lot of emails actually, people saying Karl please don't leave, we don't want to see the show ending, blah blah blah blah. What exactly is...

And we've had a couple of calls about bringing back Cheeky Freak of the Week, and d'you know what Karl said? Bloke was on the phone, he said "Oh, bring back Cheeky Freak of the Week", he went "Can't. Not allowed". And he went "Oh, go on", he went "Well no, I had a story today,
A fella born with two dicks, but I can't do it".
Now, Karl, you cannot not do a feature about a fella born with two dicks.
Well, we'll look if we need it. I mean, how much more have you got on the Chinese?
We've done that. We've nailed Chinese, we've done it. That's done. That's put to bed. Fella with two dicks please.
No, we might get around to it later. But, like I say, Cheeky Freak of the Week, sort of— we've put that on hold at the moment.
So, what have we got? What are we doing?
Well what are you providing then, today? Have you got a quiz for us?
Er, yeah we've got whatshername if you want. We've got...
Yeah, whatshername, yeah. What girl am I thinking of?
Songs of Phrase? We've got that...
Got some Monkey News that goes without saying.
I told a bit of Monkey News, I did a photo shoot at the zoo this week, and one of the people in charge...
Trying to make yourself look good?

They told me that they used to have an orangutan, right, but it escaped. It worked out— it lifted up a drain, got out of the drains and got out up into the zoo. It actually did a Colditz-type escape, right?
And Karl goes "what happened?" I said, well they sort of like surrounded it and got it back in. He went "that's no good though". I mean, it's not Monkey News unless it steals a car and goes to Spain!
Exactly, yeah, or opens a small bistro.
I mean that's real, that actually happened! But it's not real unless it— you know, takes a gun, gets
Mistaken for a president and, you know...
Yeah, and runs a country for three years.
There was some more news about London Zoo this week, about— they're all excited because they got an anteater in there.
Is that good? Is that exciting?
No, I think they've had an okapi born.
It's got a long nose, it's like a sort of tapir type thing.
Not interested. Have I said to you before about if an animal is named after what it eats, how interesting is it?
But an anteater is the only one, isn't it?
Well there's flycatchers, there's— there's lots of animals that are named after what they eat. Aren't there?
Seems ill-informed. I can't think of many beyond anteater. You talked about— you're talking about the zoo though, I was watching the news last night and it had a feature about Madame Tussauds.

It was saying that they scrapped many of the royal family. Now, I don't— but I've never understood the appeal of Madame Tussauds. I just genuinely, with no irony, cannot see the appeal of having my photo taken next to a waxwork of J.Lo.
I can't compute why that would be fun. I don't know— what is it, do they
Move? Cause they don't move, do they?
So genuinely, I mean it's crowds of people queuing up and— people queueing to have their photo taken with the royals and I don't...
The queue would put me off immediately.
I mean, it's just down the road isn't it?
But is it so you go home to your family, you go there's me, I'm— there's me with Kylie. There's me with Britney Spears.
It's not Kylie is it, her eyes look a bit funny.
Oh no it's just a wax effigy.
Oh I thought you met her.
No no no, it's just a waxwork.
It's not even the real person. If you've been to Madame Tussauds, if you have any understanding of why the appeal there— email in and tell me...
Hold on, wait a minute, let's not diss 'em
Because they might melt down Ricky Tomlinson one day to do me.
Yeah, yeah. So I don't want to put 'em off.
But seriously I mean, I'm not being...
You know Roy Kinnear might be in there and he'd make...
What is the appeal? Genuinely what is the appeal, to walk around a number of life-sized effigies...
But that's the same as look-alikes, when I see at the back of the stage and it's got, I dunno... "Susan Gooding is Caprice".
And you want to go, what d'you do with her? Oh,
500 quid she comes and stands at your party.
And people go, "she looks a bit like Caprice". Yeah don't go too close, she does yeah.
It looks a bit like her.
There was one at the back of the stage that was "so-and-so... is Jordan", and it was a woman— a sort of buxom girl wearing very little.
Buxom! Are you from the West Country?
But I thought to myself, if you're willing to get your norks out pretending to be Jordan, just get 'em out and become a Page 3 model!
And call yourself after another Middle Eastern country.
Very strange. But you've got a look-alike now, haven't you?
But it's a bloke, right, sort of at his desk, right...
In the picture, and it's David Brent.
As I remember it's just an old fat bloke with a beard.
Play a record Karl. No need for that.

metadata.song_track: The Man Who Sold The World - Live

transcript.content: Nirvana - The Man Who Sold the World
Radiohead, yeah? And "Go to Sleep" on Xfm 104.9. Don't go to sleep! We've got some...
...more fun and great tunes coming up. Alright?
Just to let you know that we've had a few new entrants on the listeners' hate poll.
I noticed Chris Evans is cropping up.
Chris Evans has snuck in a couple of times. We've also had Jordan added to the list along with Mick Hucknall.
I think that's because you reminded people.
I know, I know, I mentioned her and...
And also— this is one I'm strongly behind, Daniel Bedingfield. If you've ever heard him interviewed...
Yeah but I can't hate him.
Oh, if you've heard him interviewed he's such a knob.
He really is a bit of a tit...
Don't get involved, see the good about this is we don't get involved.

This is not— does not necessarily reflect our opinions. There are a couple of people that are cropping up that I'm right behind, but I'm not going to give that away. So don't don't give your opinion Steve cause then we're— then our hands are clean.
Do you know who I think is a comedy genius?
Chris Moyles. But let's move on, let's not—
Well, we'll be giving the top ten of you, the listeners, votes. Uh, probably about two o'clock. And then from that list -
If Karl doesn't lose the list.
And, uh, from that list, we'll probably try and draw up the top three, maybe.
Okay, so quiz time. I know everyone's been looking forward to this: which quizzes -

Well, we're going to play along because he's done, uh, songs of phrase where he, uh, cuts up, um, ah, bits and pieces from, um, ah, records. You have to guess the title or the artist and, uh, makes a well-known phrase.

I.E. a phrase that we've said a lot under the challenges that me and Steve have got to try and work out what it is as well, before we tell, we will tell you the phrase but let me just see if I can guess. Play it.
Songs of Phrase - Tell me why, tell me why, tell me why, don't they play the game of swing ball.
Right. I know what that is.
I didn't hear it. Can you play it once more for me?
Right, right. I know what that is, right. It's why don't they play the game of swing ball cause that's what he said when he turned on and saw people in wheelchairs playing tennis.
Songs of Phrase - Tell me why, tell me why, tell me why, don't they play the game of swing ball.

That is so naughty. This show's been a bit naughty, I think. I don't know what's happened to us. I think it's, it's, it's like, um, sort of end of term sort of madness, but I think we've gotta calm down here. Was been a bit naughty there. We've already said, you know, bloke with two dicks. We said Chinese people don't talk properly, which is a little bit -
Yeah. Y'know what I mean, Karl?
Right, okay, let's leave it then.
Okay. Stop there, Karl. Karl does not necessarily reflect the opinions of Xfm -
If you think that me and Steve have been offensive, we are strongly behind the guise of irony, satire, and ignorance. Karl only has ignorance.
No, no, no, but as long as you say something good about someone, you can also say something bad about them.
Go on then, give us an example.
Women, the women, women really good looking as, as, as younger people.
I'm just, I'm just saying as long as you, you know, I mean, there's good and bad in everything.
Well what are the old ones like?
They, they, they don't age well.
The fella in Karate Kid, the teacher, was only about 36.
We started this. We started this.
Email in. Ricky dot Gervais at xfm dot co dot UK, right?
Well I have to say, Karl, these are very tricky this week. You've got some very obscure sounding songs there.
Yeah, just all we want is the artists.
I think just the song, Karl, mate.
I think that's harder, I think that's harder.
Okay, so these are the prizes this week.
Well, let's, let's play it again so they can hear it. Try and work out all the different artists.
Songs of Phrase - Tell me why, tell me why, tell me why, don't they play the game of swing ball.
But there's some great prizes, um, including, Karl, I can't help but notice, torn from the current, well, I think today's issue of the Daily Mirror.
What, he's giving away a giveaway?
It's a free CD from the Daily Mirror.
You can buy— spend 30p on The Mirror and you can get this anyway.
But it's still in the piece of plastic that it came in!
Anyway there are some other treats...
Oh you'll be loving getting that through the door.
So there's "The Jingly Jangly Sound of Summer - Good Vibes", a 2CD set featuring music from Crowded House, R.E.M., Simon & Garfunkel and the Beach Boys.
I tell you what, I've thought of another game. We can put Karl's— into theory, right. I can tell him a person, or a people, or a place,
Right, or a profession, and he's gotta come up with a good and bad.
A good and bad thing, that sounds great.
Are we ready to do this?
Well, listen, if we're quitting in the next couple of weeks then who cares?
Well hang on, whoa let me just— we're on the prizes here.
"So Now 55", I know there's a lot of Xfm listeners who are going to be looking forward to the likes of S Club 8 and the Fast Food Rockers, they're all on there.
I can't wait, what is their second single going to be about?
The Smashing Pumpkins, this is quite a good

Little compilation of B-sides and live performances and stuff like that, which is not bad. "The Best Summer Holiday Album in the World Ever", I think we've given that away in the past, all sorts of stuff on there. Plus the director's cut of "True Romance" on DVD, the Tarantino-scripted...
So there's some quite good prizes, let's play it once more Karl.
Why don't they play the game of swing-ball.
Just the artists, yeah? That's all we're after.
Songs of Phrase: tell me why, tell me why, tell me why, don't they play the game of swing-ball
Let's put a song on. Bit of Pharrell Williams?
Good and bad, good and bad, old people.

metadata.song_track: I Believe in a Thing Called Love

transcript.content: The Darkness - I Believe in a Thing Called Love

Darkness, "I Believe in a Thing Called Love" on Xfm. 104.9. Ricky Gervais, Steve Merchant, Karl Pilkington. Karl set the ball rolling with Songs of Phrase — why don't they play swing-ball? Referring of course to people in wheelchairs who play tennis, cause he was disappointed they weren't getting around the court quickly enough.
So why didn't they play swing-ball?
Brilliant. Someone just emailed in saying "because, if they hit it to the top they wouldn't be able to reach it to unravel it".
Which is a good point. But I mean, nonetheless. Good and bad, people in wheelchairs, d'you want to do that? Good and bad, good and bad things about people in wheelchairs.
Dunno really, they take up less room in cinemas? They've got their own seat.
Yeah, yep, good, well done. Well done.
Dunno, I'll have to think about it.

The hate list. Can I just return your minds to the hate list. I said on the hour that we would give you basically the top five. Now, we have to stress this is the top five most hated people that you the Xfm listeners have suggested to us. We have not massaged these...

...we have not made these up, these are coming from you. Last week we began it, this week you've continued to email. So this is the list. We do not endorse this list, some of them we may agree with, some of them maybe not but it's the list that you have come up with. We are merely the messengers.
I tell you who was coming through recently —
Cameron, but he didn't make the top five.
I'm afraid he was just a late entrant really.
Williams dropped out of the top five.
Robbie Williams, surprisingly, dropped out of the top five.
So let me tell you now, in no particular order, this is the top five that you have voted for.
Xfm— well I say Xfm listeners, people who listen to this show. I don't think— I mean Xfm listeners aren't typical radio listeners, and I think our listeners aren't typical Xfm listeners.
So, I don't know what this poll is worth. What ANY poll's worth. But I mean, this one is probably worth very little.
In a way it's sort of worth-less.
Yeah. Go on then, who's the top five in no particular order?
So we want you the listener to then just vote— email in with the one name that you hate the most and then from this list...
...we can figure out the number one.
But this is in no particular order: Chris Tarrant.
I don't think he's that surprising. Cause I mean...
Well, anyway, I'm not going to editorialise.
No I'm not saying— I'm saying, I imagine Xfm listeners pretty much despise someone like Chris Tarrant.
OK well anyway, Chris Tarrant's on there. Davina McCall.

Now I'm not going to say anything, those are the names that you have drawn up. There are lots of others that didn't make the top five, Richard Madeley was on there, Michael Flatley. Vorderman, bizarrely, I thought that was...
Very strange. So Jamie Oliver, a lot of votes for him but he's not made the top five. So those are the top five, just email in with the number one...
...that you hate. And we're talking about someone...
And this time we did it. Ohhh, dear.
Moyles, Norton, Kielty, McCall, Tarrant. It's your choice.
Who would you have out of this?
Who would you have in your list Karl? You're allowed to talk cause people know your opinions don't matter. So, what?
I honestly don't really hate anyone...
...that much. I'm not that fussed, d'you know what I mean?
We're not talking so much about hate, we're talking about someone that annoys you...

Yeah we don't mean hate, you can't hate any of these people, all they've done is pop themselves up on telly. But I think it's people who— as one listener, she put it— I think she had some of those, and she said, "I don't hate them, these are the people that if they pop up on my telly I have to turn over".
You know what I mean, you don't hate them you—
But sometimes it's not their fault, it's like Davina, right, I used to quite fancy her. And now cause she's always on the telly it's like ugh, I can't be doing with her now.
But she's still the same presenter, it's just that I'm bored with it.
So, I'm not getting involved in it.
Let me just give the email address...
Let me just give the email address! I just said it, so don't walk over it.
OK. I'm gonna do Karl's top thing.
Ricky.gervais@xfm.co.uk. That's also the email address for your answers to this week's Songs of Phrase, play it again Karl if you
Compilation - tell me why tell me why tell me why don't they play the game of swing ball.
We just want the artists, is that right?
I've got, I've got, I've got two that you, you, you don't like. Not, not, not that you hate them, but you sort of like, don't agree with em. Um, would liverpudlians be in your list?
What about, um, gay fellas in toilets looking at yah?
Em, well, I think they've sorted that out.
One of the prizes this week in Karl's goody bag features this song. Play it, Karl. The Monkees. Pleasant Valley Sunday.

metadata.song_album: Pisces, Aquarius, Capricorn & Jones Ltd. (Deluxe Edition)

transcript.content: Monkees. Pleasant Valley Sunday. Brilliant. Xfm 104.9 Karl Pilkington.
This show is monkey-heavy, isn't it?

It is monkey-heavy. Karl, if you were president, would you sort of make compulsory to maybe have a little, little monkey? Everyone has a little monkey of their own? Little chimps helping our old age pensioners?
It's not a bad little, uh, it's funny, you know cause there was, um, a story the other day when I was looking for monkey news.

There was a story about a couple who, who couldn't have any kids, right? There's something wrong with them, but they really wanted a kid and they got some, uh, dodgy email address where they could buy a baby online, right? It was someone who would have a kid and you could buy it for 3 grand or something, right?
So anyway they got one, they got picked, and like, brilliant. There's the money.
Got the baby and everything. They were loving it. Um, you know, playing with it and stuff. As it got older -
Turned out, they've been sold a chimp.
You, you maniac. You stupid manc twat.
Don't talk shit. That is, as IF.
What?! Oh don't talk, are you, are you mental?!
Didn't make it into monkey news!
Well, it's a bit sad though. We don't like to bring -
Yeah. And how long was this into, it got hairier? They're born hairy!
They're not born like humans, then develop hair, because they go "hold on, we better, we better get the chimp stuff kicking in now cause we're in the jungle!"
School photograph. Do I, hang on a minute? It looks a bit weird.
Oh, you are just, the, the -
The rubbish, mad, innit? Mad, innit? Mad, innit? Imagine, oh god, just imagine if he was in charge. We did put him in charge of the country.
Wouldn't that be amazing. Let him run the country.
Or, or the mayor, or what would you do if you were the president or the lord mayor of London.
I wouldn't do it. I wouldn't want to do it.
I wouldn't do it, like he's gonna be offered it! It's a hypothetical question, Karl.
No, but su-Suzanne was, uh, alright, me missus, if you're a new listener.
She was watching the news trying to follow some heavy stuff and I'm like ohh, d'you know what I mean...
